first_story_block:
You; "I've always thought of myself as one of the fortunate ones. Always had friends, top of my class, y'know.

Until 3 weeks ago. I started getting these headaches. 


All

    The

            Time...


I was scared, so I went to the doctors.

They told me it was a tumor.

And I had to have it taken out.

                                                         Fast.


 



So here I am. At the hospital, in this bed, in this room. They say I should be asleep soon. I don't feel sleepy.

What if the anesthetic isn't working!?


Oh wait...............................

action_results.result:
Opening my eyes, I see a bright white light.

And I see my mum, next to me. She's holding my hand.

You; "Did it work?"


Nothing.


You; "Mum?"

Nothing.

You; "MUM! MUM! MUM?"

I'm so scared, it this it? Am I dead? Is this what being dead is? I'm going to see everything!? Oh, God help me!!!

You; "Mum? Mum?!"


What's that? I hear...footsteps...


???; "Shut up already!"

You; "Who are you? What have you DONE to me?!"

???; "Calm down already!"

She muttered something under her breath that sounded something like "by Odin...".




Turning to see her, I could tell that she was roughly my age, with pale blonde curls and extremely bright blue eyes. She appeared to be in HD, compared to the room around me, which was pale and blurry. I then noticed she seemed to be on the other side of a window. But there was no window there...

???; "Look, just trust me, she isn't going to hear you. So just give up already, your noise is annoying me."

You; "Who the hell are you?!"

???: "Name's Valkyrie, kid. But just call me Val. Someone's a long way from Kansas, huh?"

You; "Very funny. "


Val; "Are you gonna get up, or what?"

You; "Huh?"

Val; "Look down."

Looking down, I saw myself, lying asleep on the bed next to mum. I looked back up. Then down again.


I was separated from my body!

I jumped out of the bed, and clambered through the window, to where Valkyrie stood.


You; "Am I..."

Val; "Dead? No, but you will be if you don't hurry."


What the hell did she mean?

I stared at her blankly.




Val; "Don't you wanna know what you gotta do?"

You; "Sure, whatever"

Val; "Jeez, could you sound LESS phazed by all this?"

You; "Not if I tried."

Val; "Haha" She giggled girlishly.  "I like you, kid. All you gotta do is find the door!"




I looked around. The hospital room had completely vanished. All I saw was white. There was no door.

You; "Easier said than done! How long do I have?!"

Val; "Didn't you ever read "Cinderella"? You have til midnight! So...six hours from now!"        

I began saying "How did you know that without a watch?", but Val grabbed my arm and dragged me forward. On the horizon, I saw the faint shadow of a large castle. 


Val; "There. That's where you'll find it. Follow me"

I pounced, aiming straight for her head.

My fist passed straight through her, like she was a hologram or something. Then she faded away, leaving behind four mocking words; "You're on your own"


I never saw her again. I never found the door. I never escaped. And so I remain. Wandering. Lost for all eternity...




There was only the light.

Val; "Great! Do you trust me?"

You; "Do I have a choice?"

Val giggled. "Nope! Now c'mon, close your eyes!"

Reluctantly, I forced my eyes closed. I heard the whinny of a horse beside me.

Val; "Open them!"


I opened my eyes. Val was riding atop majestic white horse, a Pegasus, to be precise, as white, feathered wings sprouted from its back, almost appearing as though Val had wings.




Val reached down to me, offering me her hand.

Val; "Jump on!"
I walked for what seemed like days, towards the rustic castle, when, only a few meters from the castle, I was interrupted by the sobbing of a little girl.

Leaving the girl behind me, I headed out. I couldn't be sure, but I thought I heard her giggling.

I walked for what seemed like days, never reaching the rustic castle, until eventually, I collapsed. The exhaustion had got to me. The last thing I saw was Val, looking down at me. Taking my hand in hers, she carried me away, the two of us, flying on her crystal wings.
The girl looks up. Her emerald eyes and rusty red hair stand out on her pale face as her hand seeks mine.

I took her hand, only to see the world melting before me, as a large clock with only six hours on it ticks away.

I looked away, back to the girl, who was screaming loudly, and pointing to something I couldn't see.

As I walked forwards, in the direction she was pointing. With every step, the world got darker.                                                                                                                                                           

                                                                                                                                                                      And  darker.                        

Black.

I turned back to the little girl, only to see her green eyes glowing in the darkness of the world.




I turned back to the darkness, afraid of her, when I saw yet another pair of burning eyes in the darkness.

I stopped dead, as emerging from the darkness, a figure of a woman in armour closes in on me, and from the corner of my eye, I see a white light.                                

The clock still ticks on behind me.

In a flash, the figure is gone.


You; "What was that?"

???; "That is what hides in the light. This place is far darker than it seems, trust me"

She seemed so mature for a little girl.

You; "What's your name?"

???; "Harpy"

action_results.action: ...Isn't that one of those crazy flying monsters?
action_results.result:
The little girl glared at me.

"Yes. It is. I hate it when people associate me with those. I HATE IT!!!"

You; "Sorry..."


Harpy; "It's ok. I shouldn't have snapped"

action_results.action: I was kidding. i like Harpy. It sounds pretty.
action_results.result:
Harpy; "Thanks!"




I giggled. She looked so cute!

Harpy; "So anyway, what we gotta do is simple! There's a cave around here, and inside that cave lives a fierce dragon. Each passing month, the villagers must sacrifice a child. A female child. That's why I need you."


You; "You're the sacrifice?"

She nodded. "Slay the dragon, and he will give you the key"

You; "Key?"

Harpy; "To the door. Your ticket outta here."

When we arrived at the cave, the ear-shattering sound of snoring battered my eardrums.




Harpy; "Here! She's right in there!"

You; "Ok!"

Harpy handed me a large crystal sword. "Take this. Strike her in the heart"


You; "Her?"

Harpy; "Yes. Don't you know that female dragons are the more aggressive? A male would never do this!"

Bracing myself for attack, I fell back in shock as a large cat with a humans face and wings sprung out.

Harpy; "Whatever you do, do NOT attack! This is the sphinx, guardian of the dragon. In return for food, the sphinx protects the dragon while she sleeps."


Then, it spoke.

Sphinx; "You shall not pass, lest answer the riddle of the sphinx."

The sphinx giggled hysterically. 


Sphinx; "What walks on four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon, and three legs in the evening?"

The sphinx' eyes open wide in shock. "You, you really did it!"


The sphinx ran away, but I doubted it would be the last time I saw it.

I wasn't out of the water yet...


The dragon had awoken! And she was angry. And she was hungry. And she was coming straight for me!


She lunged at me, blowing fire at me!
The flame narrowly misses, the dragon takes a deep breath, preparing for another blow

I dodged-Too Early! The dragon simply swung its head around and scorched me alive. 


The End...

In the dragons moment of weakness, I plunged my sword straight into its heart, and pulled it back, leaving serrated shards of crystal stuck inside of the gaping hole in the dragons chest. 


The dragon let out a groan, and with its dying breath, released a flame so huge, so inescapable and powerful, there was only only one option...

I ran straight into the flame!


I was burned to a crisp in mere seconds!


 



 

My one regret is that I never got to see my mother again.

I defend against the blast, shattering the crystal sword and blasting me back. 


I crept up to the dragon, and after an explorative nudge, I ascertained that the dragon was, in fact, dead.


In its clasping hand, the dragon held a key, which I took, and deciding that Harpy was safe now, took to the stone door at the back of the cave.

action_results.action: Place the key in the lock
action_results.result:
SLAM!




The sphinx slams into the cave, blocking your path.

Seeing what you have done to the dragon, the sphinx shrieks with rage, clawing at your face.

I ran, but tripped and fell, covering my face, I braced myself for the attack.

THUNK!

I looked up, to see Valkyrie, now in full Viking armour, flying on crystal wings, attacking the sphinx.


 



Swooping in behind her, an angry looking woman with talons like a birds for feet, and purple, feathered wings swept into the cave, kicking the sphinx onto it's back.


 



Valkyrie raised her golden spear and drove it into the heart of the sphinx, who died, releasing a powerful shriek that echoed around the cave.

You watch as Valkyrie's wings fold neatly into her back, and her armour is replaced by jeans and a white/gold top.

The other entity begins to shrink, her wings dissolving as she reassumed her true form. Harpy.


You; "Harpy! Val! You saved me!"

Val; "We couldn't just let you die now, could we?"

Harpy; "Tell no-one of this."

I nodded. 


Val; "Are you ready?"

You; "Huh?"

Harpy; "It's time to go home now."

You; "Can't you come with me?"


They shook their heads.


Harpy; "Even if we could..."

Val; "Harpies and Valkyries don't get on at the best of times. This was...neccessary."

After thanking them again, we walked through the door.

Me, Harpy and Val wandered through the field, reminiscing like old friends. When the time came for us to part, Harpy turned to me.

Harpy; "Look after yourself" she smiled, handing me a purple feather suspended from a gold chain.

Harpy; "To remember me by"




I watched as the little girl grew, sprouted purple wings, and flew away.

Val; "I'll miss you"

She handed me her necklace. Two white gold wings embracing a drop of nectar coloured crystal.

Val; "So you'll never forget me"

You; "I never could Val. Never"

Val nodded.


You; "Will I ever see you again?"

Val; "That depends...How tightly can you shut your eyes?"

Rustilly, my tired eyes open, to find my mother.

Mum; "Hey sweetie! The operation worked!"

You; "How long was I out?"

Mum;"Six hours, but you're awake now."


I clutched at my neck, not finding the necklace.


You; "Mum, wheres my necklace?"

Mum; "Right there."

You; "oh"

I looked down, to see the purple feather that hung around my neck, but Valkerie's necklace was nowhere to be seen.


After I recovered, I searched for "Valkyrie" on the internet.

"Valkyrie.

Angel-like female figure (Goddess) who Vikings believed to have chosen the souls brave enough to enter Valhalla, and to entertain those who did by serving mead etc. Often believed to have taken the form of a raven in order to report to Odin"




Angel-like? Though from what I found, Valkyries are more commonly know as "angels of death", my Valkyrie was different. Rather than moving my soul on to heaven or Valhalla, she brought me back. My friend. Valkyrie.


I was distracted by the flutter of wings, I couldn't be sure, but a black figure, which to this day I swear was a raven, flew past my window, dropping the necklace on the windowsill. 




I ran to the window, to see Val, walking away. She turned and smiled back at me, then, waving as she went, disappeared into the bustle of people. 




I never saw her again.

But one day, I swore I would tell people of Val, and all we did, and when I did, I would write our story for all to see.

And that, my friend, is what you have just finished reading.


 

  Valhalla...

I blocked the dragons fire, but in doing so, the heat shattered my sword.


Running as fast as I could, I tried to dodge, but I was too late.


The fire had consumed me in seconds. 


The last thing I knew was unbearable pain...

The sphinx chuckled.  "Wrong answer"

The last thing you saw was the sphinx' claws, tearing your face apart.
Sphinx; "True, I suppose. However, not the answer I had in mind"
Sphinx; "Seriously?"
The sphinx laughed
The sphinx giggled maniacally. "Ooh, I'm scared!"
The sphinx chuckles. "I like you... Now, would you like to hear the riddle?"

You; "You have no power over me! You're just a stupid, good-for-nothing lowlife, ugly monster!"


 

That was a bad choice. The sphinx charges at you, spearing you off of the cliff.

Harpy; "Then I wish you well. Take this"


She handed me a crystal sword. 


Harpy; "Strike her in the heart. And beware the sphinx"

I trekked up the mountain alone, proud that I had spared Harpy the hardship of the climb.

Upon my arrival at the cave, I followed Harpy's instructions, but found that the "Sphinx" was not around, but the dragon was awake...




And she was hungry!

She lunged at me, blowing fire at me!

She looked sad.


Harpy; "I understand. The choice is your own. Venture to the kingdom of ErenForth. A friend awaits you."
Harpy; "Well, come on! We haven't all day!"
I headed for the castle in the distance, wondering what would become of Harpy, the little girl I found by chance.

Gradually, the light returns.

Turning back, I could no longer see the little girl or the darkness, and soon found myself at a rustic castle.




As I enter the courtyard, cheerful flute music sounds from an archway surrounded by flowers. To my left, there is a mossy, worn door from which growls and hysterical laughter can be heard.

If only Val were here, she may know the answer.
The last thing you see is Valkyrie's disappointed face as you are dragged away by a dark shadow...

You ran straight through the door without even looking back.

You have chosen...wisely.


 

Soon you arrive in a large hall, with high ceilings and long tables filled with food. It seems you have stumbled upon a medieval feast. The hall is alive with people, and the cheerful music from the courtyard that seemed to be coming from the other door, in fact originates from here.


At the end of the hall, I see  a raised podium, upon which two thrones were situated. Upon one of the thrones sat a portly man with a golden beard to match his golden crown, who gestured for me to approach him.


 



???; "Why hello. My name is count Vladimir, but my friends call me Vlad"


I couldn't stop thinking of vampires, but refrained from asking, just in case.


 

"Vlad" surveyed me with a look not unlike that of someone who had just stepped in excrement and was in the process of scraping it distastefully off of their shoe.


Vladimir; "I suppose you're looking for the door? Hmm?"


You; "Yes sir."


Vladimir; "And what do I get in return?"


 

I couldn't tell if he was serious or not. I was about to ask, when a tall, pale man with a thin face, black hair and a black goatee to match playfully shoved Vladimir. He too wore a golden crown, that was the only thing that lit up his face, barring the warm smile that was so out of place on his face.


Strange, but they both seemed so opposite to their appearances. Vladimir looked cheerful and was yet so grumpy, yet this new man, who looked so cynical of the world had already smiled more in the first second of meeting him than Vladimir had since we arrived.


???: "Come on, brother, get off my throne!" He laughed, pushing him again.

Vladimir; "Just keeping it warm for you, brother" he chuckled, giving the man a playful punch on the arm as he moved to his own throne.

Vladimir; "We have many brother, it is a feast after all."


???: "Oh, details, details" He waved it away.


???; "I am king Richard of ErenForth. You have already met my brother and fellow king, Vladimir?"

Vladimir grunted boredly. 


 

Richard; "Forgive my brother, he's ever so shy when meeting new people."


Vladimir rolled his eyes.


Richard; "So, the door. It's right through here."


He gestured to a door at the back. I was rather confused. If it was so easy to get to the door, why had Val never left?


Barging through the hoards of party goers, we made our way to a small room with two doors. Vladimir stood when we did and followed.


The two brothers then each stood before the doors.


 

Richard was first to speak. "You must choose a door, by way of completing our riddle."


Vladimir; "One of us always tells the truth, and one of us always lies."
Vladimir; "What would you like to know?"
"He'd tell you to go through the door on the right"

Richard looks disappointed. "Me!"

Val entered the meadow. As she shut the door, it disappeared.

She hugged me again. "Well done, I only wish you'd have let me come with you!"


 

You; "I guess this is the kind of thing I have to find out on  my own"


Val shook her head.


 

Val; "Of Course"

Mounting them, we rode through the forest, talking like old friends, of pointless things like the people on tv, or my crush at school and stuff. 


 

Soon, we saw a small door in the middle of the field. A brown wooden door with my name carved into it.


 

Val; "Your mum's waiting."


 

You; "I want to see her again, but I don't want to leave you, Val. You're my friend."


 

Val smiled a sad smile.


-+

She put her hands behind her neck and unfastened the clasp of her necklace. It was a beautiful necklace, two white gold wings caressing a gem the colour of  honey or nectar.


She then placed the necklace around my own neck.


 

Val; "So you'll never forget."


 

You; "I never could forget, Val. Never"


 

We hugged goodbye, and I left through the door.


 

Val; "If you ever want to remember, just call my name..."
You; "She said just call her name. Should I?"

I opened my eyes to see my mum and my little sister Ari.


You; "Did it work?"

Mum smiled at me. "Yes, honey, it worked. You should be fine now."

You; "Great."

Mum; "Are you ok?"

You; "Yeah, it's just... I can't help but feel like I've forgotten something..."




I quickly recovered and now I feel better than ever! Things have never felt so good!

I often wonder, in the evenings when I'm alone, what it was that I forgot.

And though I have dreams of this girl, this winged being Valkyrie,

I can't help but wonder, who is she?


I guess I'll never know...

 Valhalla...

Val giggles and hugs me. 


Val; "This might be the last time you see me. It's a riddle. Choose the door you think is right. I'll see you on the other side!"

Richard stepped forward. "Accept or decline, it is your choice."

You ran straight after Val without even looking back. That archway was one forbidden fruit that you were not willing to gamble on.

Soon you arrive in a large hall, with high ceilings and long tables filled with food. It seems you have stumbled upon a medieval feast. The hall is alive with people, and the cheerful music from the courtyard that seemed to be coming from the other door, in fact originates from here. Valkyrie marches up to you, and shouts over the music.


Val; "I was beginning to wonder if you really were coming, or if you'd gone to check out the archway. Good choice!"

She gave me a thumbs up.

You; "Well, the whole being dragged off screaming thing didn't particularly appeal to me"

I laughed. Val giggled, then pointed to a raised podium, upon which two thrones were situated. Upon one of the thrones sat a portly man with a golden beard to match his golden crown, who gestured for us to approach him.




Val; "This is Vladimir."

I couldn't stop thinking of vampires, but refrained from asking, just in case.

Val; "Vlad, this is my friend"

"Vlad" surveyed me with a look not unlike that of someone who had just stepped in excrement and was in the process of scraping it distastefully off of their shoe.

Vladimir; "I suppose you're looking for the door? Hmm?"


You; "Yes sir."

Vladimir; "And what do I get in return?"


A tall, pale man with a thin face, black hair and a black goatee to match playfully shoved Vladimir. He too wore a golden crown, that was the only thing that lit up his face, barring the warm smile that was so out of place on his face.

Strange, but they both seemed so opposite to their appearances. Vladimir looked cheerful and was yet so grumpy, yet this new man, who looked so cynical of the world had already smiled more in the first second of meeting him than Vladimir had since we arrived.

???: "Come on, brother, get off my throne!" He laughed, pushing him again.


At this, Vladimir cracked a smile, breaking the grimace that was so out of place on his face.

Vladimir; "Just keeping it warm for you, brother" he chuckled, giving the man a playful punch on the arm as he moved to his own throne.


???: "Oh! Forgive me! Vlad, you didn't tell me we had a guest!"

Vladimir; "We have many brother, it is a feast after all."

???: "Oh, details, details" He waved it away.

???; "I am king Richard of ErenForth. You have already met my brother and fellow king, Vladimir?"

You; "Yes. You're both king?"

Richard; "Indeed. Having one monarch at once results in conflict. Have you not noticed? Thus, me and Vlad over here share, so we may remain at peace with one another and ourselves.


Vladimir grunted boredly.

Richard; "Forgive my brother, he's ever so shy when meeting new people."

Vladimir rolled his eyes.

Richard; "So, the door. It's right through here."

He gestured to a door at the back. I was rather confused. If it was so easy to get to the door, why had Val never left?

Barging through the hoards of party goers, we made our way to a small room with two doors. Vladimir stood when we did and followed.




The two brothers then each stood before the doors.

Val looked at me, an unreadable expression on her face.

Val; "You gotta choose a door." She looked at her wrist, which still bore no watch. "In record time! You still have four hours!"


I was rather confused.

action_results.action: Shout "I'm coming" and investigate the archway
action_results.result:
It can't be that bad....

You follow the music to the archway, but hesitate before entering.

Was Val telling the truth? Was this really terrible? Or did she want me to never find the door so she wouldn't be alone anymore?


I suppose this is where I find out if she truly is my friend...

Curiosity gets the better of you.

You waltz up to the arch, certain that Val was exaggerating.

But at the last second, you stop.


Val's my friend. She wouldn't lie to me, would she?

I shuddered, feeling the world changing around me. I get my bearings, only to find myself in a beautiful meadow.

A small blonde girl plays in the grass before me.




I being to speak, when I am interrupted.

???; "Valerie? Valerie sweetheart? There you are!"

The man, who seems to be her father waits with out stretched arms.

Valerie; "Daddy!"

The little girl jumps into his arms.




You; "Hey there"


They didn't seem to hear me.

Then they walked away, and as they did, the little girl's familiar blue eyes looked straight at me.

The meadow spun, the leaves grew dry and fell off, and snow filled the meadow, the snow melted and the sun shone brightly.

Though it had only been a few seconds for me, the little girl, who was now once again happily playing in the field seemed older somehow.




Valerie; "It's you"

You; "Huh?"

Valerie; "The person in the meadow. I saw you, a year ago. Daddy didn't believe me, he said he couldn't see you"

You; "Really? Well, um, where am I?"

Valerie; "The meadow. Valhalla city, Scandinavia, 1984. Duh!"


She stuck out her tongue.

1984!? I had traveled back in time! But why here? Why  now? And why did I appear to be following the story of this little girl?


We talked for a while before she had to go.

You; "Ok, so you like ice cream and ponies... and ravens?"

Valerie; "What's wrong with ravens?"

You; "Nothing, it's just... They're a little dark"

She slapped my arm. "You're a little dark!" she laughed, but I began to wonder if her words held another meaning.


You; "Do you have a boyfriend?"

She blushed.

Valerie; "No..."


 



 

I looked at her.

Valerie; "Ok, I like him, but he doesn't know! And you can't tell anyone! Promise!"

You; "Ok, ok!"

She held out her pinkie. I took it.

Valerie; "And remember; if you break a pinkie promise that means you're a pig!"


We laughed.

You; "So who is he?"

Valerie; "Just a boy in my class"

You; "What's his name?"

Valerie; "You wouldn't know him"

You; "I'll have to tickle it out of you!"


Valerie; "No!"

She screamed, running away.

Valerie; "I'll tell you." She looked around suspiciously, "His name's Arthur, and he's the sweetest, most funniest, gorgeous-est guy in the school! And that's why he'd never like someone as dumb as me."

You; "Don't say that, you're the coolest kid I know!"

Valerie; "Really?"


I nodded, already imagining what my little sister would think if she heard me say that.

Valerie; "Thanks!"


Then the world spun again.

This time, I was in a school.

Valerie was there, talking to her friend.




Valerie; "I really like him Christie!"

Christie; "Then ask him already!"

Valerie; "I'm too scared!"

Christie playfully shoved her. "Go!"

Valerie; "I'm going, I'm going!"


She turned around, only to bump into a boy her age with long, shaggy hair.




Valerie; "Umm, hi, Arthur, I umm.... Wanted to, um, well-"

Arthur put his finger on her lips.

Arthur; "Christie told me." At this, Valerie looked angrily back at Christie. "Look, I really like you. Wanna go see a movie or something?"


They exchanged numbers, and Valerie walked back to Christie, a massive smile plastered onto her face.

Valerie; "YAY!"


The room span again.

Valerie and I were back in the meadow, but this time we weren't alone. She was a lot older now, almost 14, I'd say, and her and Arthur still seemed to be going strong.

I only wondered, why was I seeing her life?




Arthur; "You look so pretty in the moonlight, Val"

Valerie giggled. I felt like an intruder.

Then she looked over at me.


Valerie; "Do you see her?"~

Arthur; "Where?"

They both looked straight at me.


Arthur walked closer.

Arthur; "Is it really you? She says you are always there, never a day older."

Valerie; "If it weren't for you, I would never have admitted I loved Arthur. Thank you."

You; "You're welcome."


The room started spinning.

Valerie; "Do you have to go again?"

You; "I guess I'll see you around."


The next time I stand in the meadow, Valerie's alone.




 

She spots me straight away.

Valerie; "You're back!"

You; "Yeah, I guess I am. How's life?"

Valerie; "It's great! Really! Me and Arthur...well"


She holds out her left hand, upon which is a diamond engagement ring.

You; "I'm so happy for you Valerie!"

Valerie; "Please, call me Val."

You; "Funny. I once knew someone nicknamed Val."

Valerie; "What was her real name?"


You; "Valkerie"

Valerie; "It's kinda like my name, but with a 'K'"


 The world began to spin.


Valerie; "Wait! Me and Arthur's wedding, you'll be there right?"

You; "Wouldn't miss it"

Everyone was there.

The wedding went on without a hitch, and though I never felt I did anything, Valerie insisted on mentioning me in her speech, and on me meeting everyone.

I'd never seen her so happy.


Her friend Christie put up a slideshow.

"My friend Val."




 

Val and Arthur were always so in-sync.




They met at our primary school and were inseparable ever since!






 

They were destined to be together.






Right from when they were kids.




 

"So let's celebrate what they have!

Congrats guys, here's to 11 years!"


They all cheered as they kissed.




 

Then the room began to spin again. My head was filled with her memories, some old some new.


 



 

Spinning


 



 

 

And spinning...


 



                                 



 

Until finally, I was on a dark street.


 



I could hear screaming, so I followed it, only to find Valerie, fighting with a man I didn't know.

Valerie; "Get off me!"

???; "Just give me your bag!"

Valerie; "No!"


I tried shouting, I tried punching him, but they couldn't hear me, my hand went straight through him, like I wasn't even there at all, and then, with a BANG, Valerie died.




The man ran away.


I cradled her in my arms, hot tears stinging my face.

You; "Val?!"

Valerie smiled weakly.

Valerie; "You...came..."

You; "I'm so sorry Val, I tried to stop him, I swear, I-"


Valerie; "Shh... What are you sorry for? I'm happy. I got to marry...(she winced) Arthur, I got to (She winced again) live my life! Thanks to you!"

You; "I didn't do anything Val!"

Valerie; "You talked to the girl that no-one would talk to. The girl who was bullied at school, you gave her hope. That girl was me. Thank you..."


And then her eyes closed. 


The world span again, and I only wondered what I would possibly be subjected to next.


I looked around. I was in a graveyard. Beside me, Arthur placed a single red rose onto Valerie's grave.

He was much older, around 40 or 50.




Arthur; "You came for her, didn't you? You were there, in the end?"

He wiped a tear from his eye as he turned to face me.

I nodded, a lump in my throat. "I'm sorry"

Arthur smiled sadly. "Why? You saved her."

You; "I didn't! I can't save anyone! Not even myself! I'M USELESS!"

Arthur shook his head.


Arthur; "She had cancer. She didn't tell you."

He said it so bluntly, so openly, it took me a moment to take it in.

You; "What?"

Arthur; "When you first met, she had just been diagnosed. She was so scared at that time, she was to afraid to have her operation, and she needed it. Fast. The only reason she went through with it was because she knew she'd be ok, because her guardian angel would be there."


You; "She thought I was her guardian angel?"

Arthur; "Aren't you?"


The world span again. 


Valerie was ill. She'd never told me... If I'd have known, maybe things would be different.

The world stopped spinning. I opened my eyes, to see Valerie, in full armour, training with a sword.




Had I gone back in time again?

Looking around, I saw ancient castles, lords, ladies and a feast.

Was I in a past life of hers?


She turned to face me.


Valerie; "You're here!"

You;"Where is here?"

Valerie; "Welcome to Valhalla!"

You; "What?"

Valerie; "Do you know nothing about history? Valhalla! Viking heaven!"

You; "But, you're not a..."


Valerie; "I guess they were right all along."

You; "Valerie, I'm so sorry about that night-"

Valerie; "It's Valkerie now. I like that better. Look, you don't have to be sorry, I know. Arthur told you everything. I'm happy here, friend. Now I get to be a guardian too, just like you! Guess I'm just special, huh?"


The world span, until I was back home.


So that was the truth about Valkerie.


 



 

 

 

AFTER YOU HAD RECOVERED.


 

Val ran, her heart pounding as she grew close, banging on the door and barging into Arthur's house.


There was a silence.


He stood and just looked for a while.


Arthur; "Am I... Dead?"


Val; "No"


Arthur; "Then how?"


Val; " It's a long story"


Arthur; "You're really back?"


He had tears in his eyes as he looked at her.


Val; "I'm not leaving. Never again"


 



 

And as she stared into Arthur's eyes, the world vanished around her, and Val knew she was finally... home.
The girl just shoved her hand at me again, insisting I take it.

A little girl.


I couldn't see her face, her head was buried in her arms.

She was sobbing loudly.

I can't just leave her, can I?

The snowy horse galloped into the sky, flying at the speed of light. The wind on my face forcing my eyes open, seeing  the world unfolding beneath me, I finally felt...alive.


And looking in front of me, I saw the girl, giggling and pointing as we soar past rivers, mountains, rainbows, and all manner of beautiful things. Val. 


Having only known her for a few minutes, I already loved her. And as I sat upon the horse, I realised that in Valkyrie, I had a friend.

Val looks over.




Val; "Yeah?"

She just laughed.




Val; "Don't we all?"

But there was something in her words, something so troubling it changed the meaning entirely.

There was not a hint of sarcasm in her voice, only sadness. I hadn't thought of it, but I wasn't the only person trapped there.

Val was alone too.

The horse cantered down to a cobblestone courtyard, in which cheerful flute music could be heard, resounding throughout the yard and ricocheting off of the walls. 




Following the sound, I dismount the horse, and begin to walk through the large stone archway.

Val grabs me by the collar, throwing me away from the sound.

Val; "Not that way"

You; "Why? It sounds peaceful."

Val; "Exactly. This place is not safe. Many friends have passed through that arch, and none have ever lived to tell the horrors that lie

therein."

You;"How do you know they didn't find the door?"

Val; "Would you scream? If you found the door? Would you beg for mercy? Cry out to your friends, tell them to run? Would you stagger out from under  the archway bleeding and crying, only to be dragged back by a shadow that giggles hysterically as your tortured screams ricochet off of the walls?"




Ouch. Was that really what was at stake here?

You;  "...I don't suppose I would."

Val; "This way".

She gestured towards an old, rusty door, blackened with soot, riddled with termites, and covered in moss and mold and all other types of filth.

Val; "Come on!"

She shouts enthusiastically, then gestures for you to follow as she runs through the door and down a winding staircase.

Val stood on the horses back, pointing into the distance.

Val; "Over there. You see? The city of ErenForth. That's where you'll find your door."

It certainly did look like a place where anything was possible. I marveled at its beauty.

Val; "Nope. There are others like me, they're just busy somewhere else."

You; "Friends?"

Val;"More or less."

Val; "I'm married."

You; "Aren't you a little young to be married?"

Val; "I'm thirty three. This place has it's advantages. I gotta say, it's a lot easier tahn losing weight or getting surgery, I'm looking twenty years younger and I'm not even trying!"

You; "Ok... So, this guy, what's his name?"

Val; "It doesn't matter. I just...can't bring myself to say his name."

She said bad things happened to her. Was he something to do with it?


You; "So what's the story?"

Val smiled, she obviously wanted to tell me this.

Val; "When I was a kid, I used to play in a meadow, and one day, after my first day at school, this boy who I met found my meadow."




Val; "I was playing in the stream, and he came over. We talked for a while, and we promised to meet there the next day. He was perfect, and I guess you could say I loved him. They say when you're a kid, you don't know what love is...probably because you don't know about....well, y'know... But the thing is, I've never felt like that with anyone else. And one day, I finally got the courage to tell him"




Val; "And well, anyway, we got together. And we grew up together."







                                                                                                                               

 

Val; "And one day, he popped the question! So, yeah, we got married!"


 

 



 

Val; "That's really all there is to it."

Val; "Gold. It was mums hair colour...and 'his' too."


                                                                                  

 

You; "Who's 'he'?"

Val; "It doesn't matter. Not anymore."

action_results.action: Am I ever gonna see my family again?
action_results.result:
You; "I want to see my mum!"

Val; "Mum... That's a word I haven't used for a long time..."




Val; "My mum...was very sick. She had cancer. She died a while back... I don't really remember her. I always remember. I was in the meadow near my house. My dad came to get me. I didn't know what was wrong. When we got home, he told me my mum had...

my mum had died while I was out playing. I never got to say goodbye."




 

Val cleared her throat and wiped the tears from her eyes.

Val; "But that won't happen to you. You'll see your mum again, and your sister too! So don't worry, I got this!"

Val; "Sixteen candles."

You; "What's that?"

Val; "A love film. It came out in 1984. The day I met...The year I met someone that changed my life. My mum wouldn't let me watch it 'til I was sixteen, but I guess the only reason it's stayed my favourite for all this time is because of the year it was released."

You; "It's funny, the things that make something special to you."

Val; "Maybe, this is all real. Maybe the world you knew is the dream. Maybe, this is the afterlife, and you're finding your way back to life before your body and soul have been separated for too long and your body dies, leaving you trapped here. And maybe...just maybe...

This Is All A Dream.

But that's for you to decide."




You; "So, this door, if I go through it, I get out of here and reunite my body and soul, or whatever?"

Val; "Pretty much"

You; "And you're helping me because..?"

Val; "Because you'd do the same for me."

I wondered; what did she mean?

I sensed I wasn't going to elaborate, and decided to leave it. After all, she was right. Maybe this was all just a dream.

action_results.action: Why me? Of all the people you could find, why?
action_results.result:
Val smiles sadly.

Val; "Because once upon a time, I could have asked you the same question."

You; "Huh, what do you mean?"

Val; "There was a time you helped me, and now I'll help you."

You; "But I don't remember you"

Val; "Because we haven't met yet. When I first got here, I was scared and alone, the only thing that kept me going was the thought that one day, I'd save you like you saved me."




You; "I don't understand. What do you mean?"

Val; "One day soon, you'll know."


I thought about that. I wanted to ask her again, but I realised; Val was very stubborn, she wouldn't tell me if I begged her to.

action_results.action: Where are you from, Val? I mean originally.
action_results.result:
Val's eyes glaze over.

Val; "I used to live in a place called Valhalla. Nice town, nice people. Just a strange coincidence I ended up here."

You; "Why's that?"

Val; "Because! My town was named after this place!"

You; "Valhalla? Isn't that Viking for heaven?"

Val; "Yep. I had a lot of good memories there."


                                                                                                                                          

 

Val; "Not that it matters anymore."

Val looked sad.

Val; "I...I don't know...anymore. I just...don't know."




You; "I'm sorry Val, I-"

She shook her head.

Val: "It's fine. I'm fine. Seriously!"

But I wasn't convinced.

Val; "Some bad things happened. Things I don't want to remember, and now, I have a sworn duty to take care of people like you. To be honest, it's a real chore."


She giggles.

You; "So, am I one of your chores?"

Val; "More of a hobby actually."

Val shudders.

Val; "When I was a... Before, something happened. Something bad." She winced.

Val; "All I know is that I'm doing good here. And that's why I'm helping you get your life back, kid! So let's go!"

Val looks over.


Val; "Hey, what's eating you?"
Val; "Well cheer up then!"
